intro: Calamistrum novehollandiae, commonly known as the New Holland calamistrum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
